meanings.definition: A calculating tool with beads or disks on rods
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people used abacuses to do math without calculators.
meanings.sent2: The students in the math class each had their own abacuses to practice with.
meanings.sent3: During the math competition, the abacuses suddenly started talking and solving problems on their own!
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an abacus, swiftly calculating the numbers without any errors.
meanings.sent5: The shiny abacuses gleamed under the sunlight, making math look like a beautiful art form.

meanings.sent1: The classroom was filled with abacuses of different sizes and colors.
meanings.sent2: She collected antique abacuses as a hobby and displayed them in her room.
meanings.sent3: The abacuses on the shelf seemed to be having a secret meeting when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The abacuses lined up on the table resembled a small army ready for battle.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the abacuses clicking together was oddly soothing, like a calming melody.
